page.title: 18The Houses We Live In<contd>
page.content: Moorcroft Road on the site of what used to be an old sandstone quarry. Because the western edge of our block is in a Green Belt area, there is a restriction on house building in this part of the city. Consequently,this area is much sought after by people who want to buy houses. The cheapest semi-detached house in our block will cost about Â£22,ooo, while the largest of the old Victorian houses may fetch well above Â£120,000. The new houses on Moorcroft Road have been selling at between Â£40,000 and Â£50,000. Our block contains a high proportion of the total private housing in Sheffield. Many people regard it as one of the best areas of the city in which they can live. This is shown in the house prices.
